lines.content: > “You can do anything, but not everything.” – David Allen ([source](https://dansilvestre.com/productivity-quotes/))

**Duke Aemon Of Old** :crown: has ~~broken out of~~ risen from the crypts _centuries_ after centuries of peace. No one knows why. Having come to the castle to investigate this mystery, you realize Aemon has excellent memory. As you fish for clues, use Duke Aemon to:
- [X] Pen events with dates and duration
- [X] Note important tasks with their deadlines
- [ ] Solve the puzzle of Aemon's return (Coming Soon!)
Here is how you can talk to Aemon:
2. Write a task description following `todo ` to save a Todo task
3. Write a task description and date with time (formatted as **description/yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm**) following `deadline ` to store a Deadline-based task
4. Write a task description and date with start and end times (formatted as **description/yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm HH:mm**) following `event ` to store an Event
5. Type `mark ` followed by the task number to mark a task as complete. Alternatively, use `unmark ` instead to mark it as incomplete
6. Type in `find ` followed by a keyword to see only the tasks containing the keyword
7. Type in `list ` to see all your saved tasks!
Play around with the main method to call other functions of Aemon like `echoAndExit` and learn more about your philosophical assistant born before Time.
Why struggle with organizing a thousand tasks when you have a thousand-year-old friend in Aemon? With him, it is:

Duke Aemon Of Old is a free, simple-to-use organization tool that can help you find order in your day.
Add a task with no deadline or time associated with it as a todo in your list. Upon addition, all tasks are marked as incomplete.
Add an event along with it start and end timings to your list. Upon addition, all tasks are marked as unattended.
Add a task along with the deadline for its completion to your list. Upon addition, all tasks are marked as incomplete.
Delete tasks from your list permanently.
Mark tasks as complete and see it relfected in your list.
Unmark tasks (or, mark them incomplete) and see it reflected in your list.
Sort your list based on tasks' deadline or time of occurence, if any and description otherwise.
Search for tasks in your list specifically by words they must contain in their description.
See your list, along with number of items, task description, status and time (if any) displayed.
Add tasks as todos, events and deadlines by adding task description and time (if applicable)
Aemon indicates the item is added to the list and the new number of items in the list
Delete tasks by specifying item number on list
Aemon indicates the item is deleted from the list and the new number of items in the list
Mark item as complete by specifying its position on list
Aemon indicates the item is marked complete
Mark item as incomplete(unmark item) by specifying its position on list
Aemon indicates the item is marked incomplete
Search for an item by a word in its description
Aemon displays a list of all the items with the word mentioned in their task descriptions
Sort the items on the list
Aemon displays a list sorted by deadlines and time (if any), and descriptions otherwise
* Represents Duke - an interactive virtual assistant to organize tasks.
* Constructs a Duke object and creates a new Ui object for user interaction
* Introduces Duke and initiates interactive conversation with user
super("Please input the correct number of arguments for each command. Type 'help' to see all commands.");
super("Write all dates in the format of yyyy-MM-dd and times in the format of HH:mm");
super("Duke Aemon detected no command from the user. Use the `help` command to see all commands supported.");
super("The folly of youth to cheat Time! Specify date and time to add events and deadlines...");
super("Duke Aemon detected no task from the user. Use the `help` command to see all commands supported.");
super("Alas! You ask me to paint outside the canvas..." +
"choose an item number from 0 to your list length! ");

public String parseFind(TaskList listOfItems) throws ArgumentNumberException{
String comment = "Here is what you are looking for!";
String comment = "Aye, what good is a phantom were he not to share what he knows?\n";
String helpList = "You may use the following commands and arguments: \n" +
"`todo [TASK_NAME]` - add a task as a todo item\n" +
"`deadline [TASK_NAME]/[DATE] [TIME]` - add a task with a deadline with date in the " +
"format of yyyy-MM-dd and time in the format HH:mm\n" +
"`event [TASK_NAME]/[DATE] [START_TIME] [END_TIME]` - add an event with a date of occurance," +
" start and end timings where date is formatted as yyyy-MM-dd and time as HH:mm\n" +
"`mark [ITEM_ID]` - mark an item, as identified by its position on the list, as complete\n" +
"`unmark [ITEM_ID]` - mark an item, as identified by its position on the list, as incomplete\n" +
"`delete [ITEM_ID]` - delete an item, as identified by its position on the list, from the list\n" +
"`find [KEYWORD]` - find items containing a keyword in their task descriptions" +
"`sort` - sort all items on the list based on their deadlines and task descriptions\n" +
"`bye` - end the conversation with me. This automatically saves the current state of the list.\n";
* Prints Duke's self-introduction and helps to customise its personality.

"But you are young blood. What brings you to these ancient halls?\n";
String reply = "Welcome, my friend!\n" + intro + quote1;
